Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SandraEd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 times over the last 3 years and the last time was June 2011 Good value for a basic hotel, free brekky, central location. Only a few blocks to the Metro and Macys Centre and all the shops around there. Lots of eateries nearby Airport bus. Had to ask for a different room last time in June tho as A/c was very noisy but they moved me instantly.

Reviews.Title: “Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: shikonhana
Reviews.Content: Service: Nice Staff who held our luggage for weary travelers and prepared our room half an hour earlier before check-in time. They also had cable and free wiifi (although for some reason it wasn't accessible the 2nd day). Complimentary breakfast provided! =D Value: Excellent! This affordable price is unbeatable for a hotel so close to Nokia Theatre or Staples Center. (I booked the smallest room with 2 twin beds on Booking.com.) Sleep Quality: Bed sheets felt clean. it's always hard to sleep well the 1st night, but it was acceptable. Cleanliness: Acceptable Location: Excellent. We could walk everywhere - the Metro, Nokia/ Staples, Starbucks, Macy's Plaza, and to other very good restaurants. Room: Acceptable. Things I noticed, but wasn't bothered too much by -The bathroom was kind of small and its door didn't close all the way. Also, our room was right across the elevator and we were able to hear people knocking or talking louder than average in the hallway. Overall impression: It's affordability won me over. I only needed a place to stay for 1 night so I booked the cheapest room. If you're staying for a few days, this may be the hotel you're looking for. But if you want to live more comfortably, you can pay a little more to upgrade. Would I stay here again? For its value and location, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ljcskmv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my son last summer while attending the X Games. It was very clean and perfect location for attending the Games just a short walk to Staples and Nokia. The hotel is old but really charming and there's an I HOP across the street.

Reviews.Title: “agreeable simplicity”
Reviews.Author: marklaseve
Reviews.Content: the hotel is tidy, clean, on a great location. Rooms may be a bit small, but for a working trip, very good. Above all, the staff was allways friendly and willing to help. for the price it is above expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FabioRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: Aged furniture and upholstery, in an aged building. Very good staff. Very good and generous breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for great price. Definitely would recommend staying here.”
Reviews.Author: MissMera
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay for a great price paid $80-90 dollars for the night. A family friend's wedding was nearby. Great location for shopping and seeing downtown sights. A tad small but it was clean, no frills, and the staff was very friendly. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: sandgropers2
Reviews.Content: A cheap no frills hotel that cleaned daily but could do with a refurbishment. The shower very small as are the rooms, but we were only sleeping there for a couple of days. Breakfast is do it yourself with lots of packets but a cool waffle machine. Some of the Staff were a bit abrupt. Will serve its purpose if you have a specific reason to be in this part of L.A. We needed to be close to Union Station and it was only a couple of train tops away. Hotel is very close to the subway and a Macy's shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “SCARRRRYYY... CREEEEPPYYY”
Reviews.Author: Anjana A
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked this hotel (yes, can't believe we did). We saw all the negative reviews and thought it couldnt be that bad... BUT, boy we were wrong! We checked in and went up the old stinky elevators to our so called "double double" room. Walking towards our room we could smell the mold with every step, the walls were beat up and then the real treat... We opened the room door! I almost threw up with disgust! The two beds were smaller them a twin size bed, the room ended before it even began! We were so scared that we refused to touch the bedsheets! My lame rewards rated it a three star... it doesnt even qualify as 1/4 star... more like a negative star! We walked out from risky-stinky-creepy-milner In short... WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER SET FOOT IN!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertobrazil
Reviews.Content: It's an OK hotel, right in downtown Los Angeles. If you dont have a car ( in L.A. it is almost an urban legend someone who doesn't!) it is good since you have easy acces to the (almost non-existence) public transport service of the City of Angels, not to mention the Blue Bus, to Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “In major need of an update and re training the staff”
Reviews.Author: freemaee
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for 3 nights while on a convention. The only reason I picked it is to be within walking distance from the Convention Center. I wish hotel "O" next door was available. It looks so much better. The location is convenient, it is safe even around 11pm. I stayed at one of the suits- it was just a bigger room with dated furniture. The TV only had two English channels. My phone's message light has been blinking constantly. It is impossible to get rid of it. The staff is borderline rude and in need of major training. Every day my key had to be re programed. The good thing was that they had try to accommodate my request for a quiet room on higher floor. My "suit" was on the 4th floor and facing the back of another building, so it was quiet. The towels were thick and nice, except the one on the sink was wet upon arrival (strange!). The breakfast was very basic. The breakfast area is so dated it looks like it's dirty.Most certainly I will NOT stay or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the problem is”
Reviews.Author: Go4Urs
Reviews.Content: It is a downtown LOS ANGELES hotel for less than $100 a night. That is what it is and that is what you get. Small (10 x 15 ish) room with a tv, dresser, desk, closet, bathroom, nightstand. It feels more like a room in someone's house than a hotel. It is in a very old building. So, if you are looking for a brand new room in a brand new building - this is not it. There are some cracks along the floor boards and the caulk might be a little old. But, the furniture has been updated a bit, and the rooms have been painted. I thought small cottage room. They were also laying new carpet in the lobby when I was there on the 6th. The lobby was already nice. I had NO view to speak of , but at the end of the hall the door was open to the fire escape which I walked out on to hang out and look down at the vagrants in the middle of the night. Breakfast - which is seldom offered at downtown L.A. hotels was adequate. The standard make your own malted waffle machine, bagels, toast, cold cereal, oatmeal packets, yogurt, orange, pineapple & apple juice, coffee, fruit. For free - perfectly acceptable. If you wanna spend, there is an 24 hour IHOP directly across the street. You can also walk over to the Sheraton and pay $15-$40 if you like. I did not see any bugs, and believe me I looked. Several buses are right out front, and you should be able to walk anywhere in downtown from here. There is a train nearby, but I'm from L.A., so I've never been on it. This is definitely not the Ritz - where I've gotten worse service. It is definitely the Milner. If you are saddity or highfalutin, this may not be your spot. But if you need a clean quiet place to crash in downtown (which should be business or sport related - b/c why else would you stay downtown?), then you should be fine. Would you expect to go to Manhattan and get a grand room for the same price? Oh, and about the homeless people or whatever - IT IS DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES. The homeless there are not hotel specific. They are downtown specific. Why are you rating the hotel on the location you chose to pick your hotel in?

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches, bugs, musty smell. Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: edw83
Reviews.Content: I think the above pretty much sums it up. Oh! Tiny room, hairs on blankets, which also smelled a lot like chlorine (maybe a good thing after all). Yes, it is cheap compared to other downtown LA hotels, but like everything else in this world you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “You're Only Here To Sleep, Right?”
Reviews.Author: ChibiCheeks
Reviews.Content: Given the prices of other hotels surrounding the LA Convention Center and if you are only in your hotel room to store your stuff and sleep this hotel is by far the best bargain around. More than that, we always look forward to the continental breakfast which is stocked with assorted pastries, juices and cereals and super yummy waffles. Another review stated that a staff person wouldn't allow them to take the food out of the dining area and to their room. I brought food from the dining area to our room everyday and had no problems. I also have yet to experience unfriendly service from the staff. I actually feel quite secure by the staff as sometimes unsavory individuals will wander into the lobby and be quickly shooed away by staff. This year we had to book a suite as all the standards were all booked. Wow. What a difference from the standard rooms. There is tons of space and the bathroom actually has a tub and massive amounts of counter space which is important for applying makeup for cosplaying. Yes the standard rooms are small and the bathrooms in them are a joke but this historic hotel must be doing something right since my girlfriends and I have booked it for the last 3 years for Anime Expo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but old and cramped.”
Reviews.Author: WingSailor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended the AARP Life@50+ event in LA for my book signing (Discovering the Cause and the Cure for America's Health Care Crisis). The Ritz Milner was a 15 minute walk from the convention center and cost 1/3 to 1/2 the price of other hotels in the area. The breakfast was included and adequate. It is a very old, cramped hotel that needs a complete refit. The elevators and halls smell "old." The queen bed almost filled the room and the plastic coverings under the sheets squeeked. The closet was small, narrow and had a 3' clothes pole at the end. There was a window air conditioner. If I need to return to LA for an event at the convention center, I would consider the Ritz Milner based on price but could not recommend the place to anyone expecting comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a party trip, not families”
Reviews.Author: h0neym00ner0827
Reviews.Content: Recently me and my husband spent a few nights here, which felt like a few too many considering the room size (our luggage barely fit anywhere). That being said, it is close to LA Live, staples center, a metro station and several good restaurants. The free continental breakfast was a nice plus, nothing fancy but pretty good. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but it does have a little pub with cheap drinks and free popcorn! I would recommend this hotel to young people going to party for a weekend, or if youre going to an event at the staples center. I would not recommend it to families. There is no pool, and it is not near any child-friendly amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelkitty85
Reviews.Content: Quite a good stay if your on a budget. The breakfast they have are pretty good. Great variety. Friendly and very helpful staff. Buses just outside the door to Disneyland. Close to trains also. And free usage of the local gym in the plaza down the street if you stay at the ritz. Great food in the area. Lots of Japanese food

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel, but rather noisy”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: Ritz Milner is a decent budget hotel that’s walking distance to Staples Center. The building is obviously very old, guest rooms (mine at least) are very small, and the furnishing very cheap (as you’d expect in any budget hotel). But I found everything – lobby, guest room and bathroom, elevators, staircase, bar – to be very clean. No funky smells, no evidence of bugs. Carpets were new, paint was fresh, sheets clean, shower tiles sparkling white and free of mold. The staff – front desk clerk and bartender – were very friendly. Free wifi and no-frills continental breakfast were a plus. And though the people in the next room had their TV on all night, I could only hear it through their door when I walked by, not through the walls from inside my room. I walked around the neighborhood at night for quite some time and never felt threatened in any way. My main complaint, and the reason I won’t return unless like this trip I can find no other accommodations, is street noise and light. One of the curtains in my room did cover the window and therefore did not block the very bright light in the alley, which shined in all night long. Also, there was a constant rumble of some machine throughout the night, I think other guest’s air conditioners. (No central air at the Milner, all ACs in windows.) And at starting at 5:45 there was a succession of what I assume were garbage trucks which made huge amounts of noise for a surprisingly long time.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel, serves the purpose, excellant brekkie, will come again”
Reviews.Author: Rosemum0207
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just a basic standard hotel, but served every purpose it should, it is a little outdated and old, it did have a very used smell about it, particularly the lifts. The rooms were sufficient for two people, my daughter and I stayed for 3 nights, the beds were comfy, and clean, the room was clean and tidy, the bathroom was basic but functional. The lock to the door was not the best but added slight reassurance. The breakfast offered was sufficient for appetite, plates always fully filled with fresh fruits, area clean, freshly cooked waffles, choice of juices. This hotel is perfect for travelers wanting to explore L.A. and so convenient for public transport, shopping, concerts and lively evening life, probably not the best for a relaxing (stay in) trip!!!! We would definitely stay here again if visiting .A.

Reviews.Title: “Anime Expo 2011; frugal choice in an overpriced town”
Reviews.Author: wy_ly2856
Reviews.Content: I booked the room and specified over the phone that I needed 2 queen beds MONTHS before I came. It's good to have low expectations and to also communicate with the people who run the place. In November 2010, the price for the room I booked was $109 now it is slightly more. They have recently raised the rates on the rooms $20 or $30 more dollars; if you book a super cheap room expect to get a lot less. Book as early as you can to avoid paying too much. The food quality is poor in this area unless one eats at a 3 star or more restaurant. The continental breakfast: wouldn't recommends since the bread tasted like it was frozen several times before we ate it. Didn't try the waffle machine but it was super popular. The tea was old and bad. Coffee had salt in it. Milk seemed okay. Delivery from other restaurants have no issues; especially dominoes. Bring allergy meds if you are allergic to dust/pollen/smog/dirty filthy LA air. The cable was pretty sweet! The internet however is dial up 56k speed... :/ The shower had a very awkward positioning and it clearly needed longer shower curtains but no one is going to spend an entire trip in a shower anyways. Bring sleep meds if you have difficulty sleeping AT ALL. Traffic is bad however it was great walking distance from Club Nokia, Los Angeles Convention Center, Nokia Theater and the Ralphs on the corner! There is no parking for the hotel; the nearby lot charges $11 daily or has a weekly rate. Air is terrible in the city, food is terrible in the city so I do not expect to come to LA in general anytime too soon; however this hotel would be the first choice if I was ever going to come again for a really important occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust2hkv
Reviews.Content: I think it was value for money looking at its location close to malls and entertainment places. If i was the owner of the hotel i would improve the breakfast ( and charge for it). Was there on a long weekend ( memorial day) and discovered that in the western world even restaurants close for breakfast, lunch and dinner!!! Kind of dissapppaointed compared to India where we work ( like donkeys!) even on weekends. All in all i will return to the hotel in a bigger room and ask them to repair my TV next time!!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Uaalumnus
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were a bit early so they didn't have our room ready yet. I made it a point to ask for the two twin beds again since I booked online and it's not guaranteed. So, a quick trip to Hollywood and back on the Metro and we checked in. The hotel does not have parking per se, but there is a lot two doors down for 11 bucks a day. That is a pretty decent deal in downtown L.A., most hotels charge in the 20-30 dollar range. There is no in and out privilege though, so be prepared to use the Metro or walk. The room is *very* small and there is no view to speak of, except for a large building next door with fading, chipped plaster coming off of the brick foundation. The shower was a stand up type (no bath) but they did include small bottles of the toiletries. They didn't give up towels, but the maid brought them within 30 minutes of our check-in without us having to ask. The television was in pretty bad shape, it was a picture tube model Zenith and it had a heavy green tint to the picture that couldn't be adjusted out. The selection of channels was not bad though. It was good enough to pacify my baseball happy friend who was along for the ride. We were in town for a concert at Club Nokia at L.A. Live, and the location did not disappoint. It is a small, almost straight shot to the venue. There are lots of things in the area, a supermarket right across the street (doesn't everyone forget sodas/snacks and dread paying the massive fee at hotels) and several 24 restaurants including IHOP and Subway. Check out was very simple and we were on our way having paid very little for the night. Keep in mind, this is a *NO FRILLS* hotel, and you are not getting much more than a bed, a roof, and a television (green). The location is excellent and I found the bed to be comfortable and the pillows to be quite serviceable (I brought one of my own anyway). The air conditioner is a window unit, and it kept my friend up, although it didn't bother me at all. Your mileage may vary. If you are planning a long stay, you may prefer to get one of the more expensive hotels that are around the area, but for a quick in and out in the heart of Los Angeles, I would definitely recommend the Ritz Wiltern if you are single or with a friend. With kids, I would probably go somewhere a bit more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chham_79
Reviews.Content: Our very first trip to the US and Dan the manager ,Chris the receptionist and Maria the ever so handy help were such warm happy people.They certainly made our stay comfy.The very breakfast some patrons i read griping about was amazingly sufficient.In fact this was where our family communed most of the time.With 6 kids from 9 mths to 12yrs old, we had no cause to complain. The venue is btw, excellent!! The Metro, excellent bus services and even shared cabs to take you to and fro to the airport.Do NOT bother to go to Macy's Plaza, its dark and dank and has lil to offer.Despite our earlier misgivings reading some of the reviews, we were pleasantly surprised and would return to stay there again. Ty guys from the Nepali sisters who flew in from all over the globe. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for LA”
Reviews.Author: SLPJD
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms to be clean and the staff very friendly. The location is EXCELLENT, near plenty of restaurants, both upscale and economical, as well as shopping. I was attending a conference at the Biltmore Hotel, which was about a 10 minute walk from the Milner. As a woman who had to walk alone after dark, the neighborhood felt safe and was well-lit. The staff was very helfpful in providing directions and assistance. The wifi internet was free and a great connection. The breakfast was very good, with fresh fruit, waffles, and cereals, and stayed well-stocked with a nice dining area. If I were traveling by myself again, I think this would be a great hotel choice, however, were my husband to come along, we would not be able to stay in the economy rooms due to their size. I was barely able to fit in the extremely narrow shower, and were my husband (who is well over 6 feet) to attempt to use the restroom, I'm fairly certain his knees would hit the wall. I often stay in economy rooms, and don't mind a small room, however, this bathroom seems entirely too narrow and I have to wonder if it may be out of compliance with some sort of guideline. My only other complaint is that when we looked online, this hotel appeared to have free parking, and it does not. Though the parking garage is only 2 doors away and seemed secure, it cost $11.00 a day, which I did not expect. Overall, the hotel economy rooms are a good choice IF you are of average height and weight.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal... Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: causeucan
Reviews.Content: went to a laker's game with my son. we had a great time. Hotel was clean, friendly staff. rooms small but good for the price. we will be back to the Milner again.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, Knats and other night crawlers-NO PARKING”
Reviews.Author: CARMANG
Reviews.Content: Well like the review before this one, I don't think this place is great and I don't want anything for FREE. In fact I believe my money could've and should've been spent somewhere else. Yes, the price seemed right but when I walked into the room I couldn't believe the size of the room. The room was just big enough for the full size bed and the dresser and a small desk and chair. Yes, the room is in Downtown but I never expected to see small baby roaches in the room and in the bathroom. At first, I tried to overlook the issue but then we saw other insects in the room that's when we had enough. It appeared to be clean but they do have a problem with bugs. We tried to get a refund on the room but the front desk said they couldn't refund our money or move us to another room. It wasn't until the hotel security got involved and actually seemed concerned that we were asked about our issues. Hotel security got us moved to another room (bug free) and even came to assist in getting the T.V. to work. Oh, I didn't mention the parking, before we decided to book this room we called the hotel direct and asked about parking. I was told or was led to believe that the hotel had there own parking. No, they don't have hotel parking but there is a private parking lot conveniently located. The cost is $11.00 for parking if you are staying at the hotel but don't think about leaving anywhere in your car because then you will be charged an additional charge of either $11.00 or you pay $20.00 for the 24 hours. Ofcourse,. we weren't told this until we had already parked our car. Street parking is free on Sunday. They did have a deluxe continental breakfast that was included in the price of the hotel. The breakfast was good and the breakfast lady was friendly. Friendly is a word for a few of the staff there but not for the manager DAN. The next morning,we approached the management to discuss the issues we had the previous night but all he said was that he was aware and that they moved us into another room. Besides being rude, he could careless about customer service or about the people staying in the hotel. No concern or regret. I don't understand how someone like that can be the manager of a hotel in busy Los Angeles not having any people skills. I believe that even when not paying top notch for a hotel it should still be clean and have good customer service. I will never stay at THE RITZ MILNER LOS ANGELES again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, good rooms and food.”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot028
Reviews.Content: People complainting on here appear to be doing so to get something for free and thats to bad. My group and I stayed at The Ritz Milner now three times. The first trip was in August and the second was in October. the first two trips were ok, but our trip last week was the best. The rooms are small, but who stays in the rooms all day anyway. The breakfast is free and a good choice of items. And the hotel is so close to everything. We had some issues with our bookings online but the Manager Dan and his staff did everything to make things right. The management on the first two visit was never seen and when we had any issues they were never addressed they had desk clerk address them. Rebeca and housekeeping are wonderful, friendly and helpful. and our room's were clean, safe and affordable. Seems this Manager Dan never sleeps because we saw him all times of day and night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. and I agree with others on here, the ones complainting are most likely ones trying to get a free room or a discount. They should go elsewhere then.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service, Phenomenal Value in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: 2_bedroom_suite
Reviews.Content: Helpful manager lives in the hotel! Staff were very helpful. Had excellent free wifi signal in the room (1205). Free breakfast was very good. A block from the 7th st/Metro Center subway station which links to Hollywood on a nonstop train. Beverly Hills is about an hour away by bus. The hotel is a short walk away from the Staples Center for 1/3 the price of the other (5-star) hotels in the area. MInd you, this Ritz is not the Ritz-Carlton, but for this price, it's a MUCH better deal in my book! The hotel is older, and I read that the standard rooms are small, but I stayed in the "king suite" which I would describe as a very comfortable, larger room (not exactly a suite as in two rooms, but very functional. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and priced right”
Reviews.Author: Happy2say
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and have stayed at The Ritz Milner on several visits to LA. But i have to say that this visit was the best. The staff seemed above par and was friendly and so helpful. The new manager there Dan Baker was professional and treated us so much better then past management. The rooms are small, but well worth the price of a safe and clean downtown LA hotel. Rooms for $89.00 and 3 blocks from the staples center can't be beat. the breakfast is good and free. I would send any of my friends and family there. I read some reviews and they sound like people who want a free room.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay....”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMV
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old but cozy boutique hotel in the center of Down Town. Everything is in walking distance. The breakfast is awesome, and you want find it any ware in Down Town. The rooms are small but comfortable. The GM was very friendly and knowledgeable about the LA area. Will come back… Thanks for making feeling welcome in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience ever...”
Reviews.Author: calip10
Reviews.Content: The experience was horrible overall. For the amount of money I paid, I excpected something better. I could have probably got far better service and rooms in a regular motel, and at a cheaper cost!! The rooms are just too crammed up. As soon as you enter the room, you get this disgusting smell from the old carpet and the curtains which I dont even want to know when they washed last. The breakfast is complimentary but is ridiculously horrible with no variety. The seating area near the breakfast also looks all worn down and unhygienic. We had booked this hotel as it was relatively close to the convention center and were expecting a decent room at least for the amount of money we paid... A friend of ours stayed in a single bedroom in the same hotel - with the bed and the desk, there was literally no place else for even his luggage!! Would never recommend anyone to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small ... but fab location ...”
Reviews.Author: LynnF1
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here for 3 nights in June as we were going to the Twilight Eclipse Red Carpet event at the Nokia Theatre. The hotel foyer is pretty impressive, even containing a grand piano! But, there is no on-site parking, the actual rooms are extremely small & a little 'tired', & the area was very noisy when we were there. However, having said all that, there was a very good range of items available for the inclusive continental breakfast, & there is a 24hr carpark right next door, plus best of all ... the hotel is only about 2 blocks away from the Nokia Theatre ... which for us, was extremely convenient. So, although the rooms were disappointing, the price was very reasonable for the location, & we would definitely use the hotel again when visiting the Nokia / Staples Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Bondiloon
Reviews.Content: We had a huge room at a good price. Breakfast was included so we could plan the day in comfort. Very close to the underground and buss routes so we were able to use public transport. Staff were friendly and very helpful. This will be our regular hotel in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was decent, but dealing w/ staff was AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: bellasmom09
Reviews.Content: This hotel booked my reservation wrong Double charged me for my room Said they refunded the amount (they didn't) They accused me of calling their AGM a FAG after they were the ones who were extremely rude to me and my banker. Even their head of operations in Detroit was rude and said his employees dont lie and they have recordings of the conversations (that's a lie because I said no such thing and if they could listen to the conversation they would know that!) Everyone there with the EXCEPTION of George Monahan was extremely rude. They were not apologetic for what they did wrong and kept hanging up on me. I already have anxiety/depression and the way they treated me left me in tears. I will be speaking with my lawyer... in fact I already have. Don't stay there. It is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: rabby59
Reviews.Content: On a grade scale of A to F, this hotel gets a Z. No aspect of the stay was acceptable in any form, and I immediately began trying to find another place of lodging. Eventually, I had to give up, and resigned myself to the worst hotel ever. Location: This is how they get you. Located across the street from Macy's Plaza and about two blocks from LA Live, it seems like a very good value for as low as $60 a night. But trust me- no matter how bad you think it is, it's worse. Much worse. Room: The first warning sign was that our door was quite literally kitty-corner another, with yet another door just to the left. The 'room' turned out to be about 16 feet long and maybe six wide. The bathroom was in disgusting condition, and the sink wasn't even in the sink- it was next to the bed, with no towel rack or even toiletry stand to put things on. We had to resign ourselves to using the dresser. The carpet and curtains were dirty, and when we tried to close the one nearest the bed, we found it was attached to the wall with a nail and not by a curtain rod! Getting into the room was a chore itself, requiring three to five swipes to get the reader to even register. The TV was from the 80s or so and didn't even work. It hung from the wall above the end of the bed, and my girlfriend hit her head on it about three times trying to get to the other side. There was no alarm clock, but that's okay- as the June 24 review stated, we backed onto an alley and garbage trucks paraded down it every morning at 6:30 AM. Service: Friendly but completely inefficient. Each day of our stay, housekeeping would take our dirty towels but never replace them, forcing us to call for new ones before taking a shower. Same with toiletry items; by the third day we had no shampoo left, and it was not replaced, nor was new soap left. Amenities: None. The hotel advertises 'free WiFi', but with the caveat that it only works in the lobby. Every day it was jammed with guests trying to get on. The ice machines didn't even work. The one elevator is still as shaky and scary as it was described in the older reviews. Conclusion: No. Just don't stay here. It's worth the price increase to stay at City Center or one of the LA Live (JW Marriott, Ritz-Carlton) hotels, or worth the trade-off in distance to stay at somewhere like the Biltmore if you're attending an event at LA Live. No matter what you think you can live with, this hotel is not suited for normal folk. About the only clientele that won't mind- and may in fact see it as an adventure- are the youth we shared the elevators with every day who were attending some nearby rave.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but didn't get much sleep!”
Reviews.Author: EvelynTommy
Reviews.Content: Very good location. The room was smal, the night lamp did not work, the electricity was no good! Girls!! heads up!! if you are depended on using a hair dryer and straightening iron or simular you are in no luck!! In our room there was bearly enough electricity to turn the TV on! EVERY frakin morning at 0630am a garbagde truck started to make alot of noise, for about a half hour. Car alarms went of, fire alarms went of.. So if you choose this hotel you must be prepeard to weak up early!! Because of the location and the good price we stil think this is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Crackhouse”
Reviews.Author: wwrrkd
Reviews.Content: Nevermind the crackheads/recovering crackheads that run the front desk, the rooms are disgusting, moldy, and haven't been cleaned in years. Our room had a doorway that lead to a small, strange corridor that didn't actually lead to anywhere. The room next door to ours had some people smoking heroin and playing weird gypsy music for three days in a row. AVOID this place.

Reviews.Title: “We would certainly come back.”
Reviews.Author: far0ut
Reviews.Content: Ritz Milner is a well kept hotel, relatively not too expensive (we booked it in Easy Click web site for less than 60 $ a night a double room). We were there for a conference and it was the best we could find in town considering our budget and needs. We would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “....It's like skid row....”
Reviews.Author: LIKED
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels you could ever stay in, I think you could have a better night sleep, staying in your car. The rooms are horrible, The service is terrible, And the free complimentary breakfast, THEY CAN KEEP IT..... I DONT KNOW IF THEY DECORATED THE HOTEL FOR HOLLOWEEN SEASON BUT IT SHURE SCARED ME.....

Reviews.Title: “Ratz Milner”
Reviews.Author: calgaltraveler
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed when we drove up--no one to help us with baggage, and we practically stepped over panhandlers to get to the entrance. Both baggage carts were dirty and falling apart--I had to fix one myself to make it usable. The suite? The bed's so close to the doorway, I was surprised it passed the fire code. Couldn't get a suitcase to roll past it into the rest of the room with lots of wasted space. Bad space planning. The bed was hard but decent, sheets and bedding seemed clean, and the DSL worked ok. We got only one threadbare washcloth, 2 older bath towels, 2 hand towels. for 1 1/4 baths. When we ordered more towels, we had to ask several times! Shower ok, no great shakes. No ice machine on 3rd floor, and no fridge in suite. The carpeting creeped me out, making me glad I had brought slippers. The "closet" wasn't enough for 2 people for 3 days--why not bigger in a suite? Everything I touched had a tackiness to it--elevator, handles, etc. My key card malfunctioned several times. Free breakfast: Had to run downstairs early to get yogurt or they'd run out; all else was cheap carbs, and the toaster didn't work. Had to eat my bagel cold after toasting it 10 minutes. IHOP's a far better choice. Hotel is close to Chase/Macy's, Staples Center, Nokia Ctr., and cheap parking garages. My advice: Stay at the Sheraton, and park in the cheap garage, and it will come out about right. This place isn't ready for prime time. We joked that maybe they misspelled the name: should be Rats Milner!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: rohrzao
Reviews.Content: Since I am new to the city and decided to move here out of nowhere coming from New York City, I had to find a hotel to stay for a day or two until I found somewhere to actually live in. After going to Holiday Inn and Figueroa Hotel and getting the answer that no rooms were available, the cab driver brought me to Ritz Milner. Yes, the room is small (5th floor), the bathroom small as well, elevators are old (but work perfectly), staff has been nice to me and answered all my dumb questions about the area and LA in general. Haven't tried their breakfast but I never eat in the morning. Overall a good place to stay for the money I am spending.

Reviews.Title: “at least it was clean”
Reviews.Author: artmarksgirl
Reviews.Content: our bedroom is larger than the hotel room, cable didnt work and we told the staff TWICE and they never came, had to borrow an iron, window was cracked, internet slow, that "breakfast buffet" consisted of oatmeal, gross waffles, and donuts. you can get that at 7-11. elevators ARE crappy. my husband instantly regretted booking this room and felt awful about it all weekend. look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: phreakytamz
Reviews.Content: The room was very, very small. The sink was literally right in front of the bed. The bathroom was also quite tiny. I was afraid to take a shower because the bottom of it was pretty gross. The bed was uncomfortable. I didn't get very much sleep because I could hear people coming in and out of their rooms. The only really good thing about this place was that it was walking distance to the Staples Center/ Nokia Center. It's okay if you just want to stay a night and if your main purpose for your trip is to see a concert or something like that... just bring something for your feet when you take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is the Pits”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and tight with little clearance between furniture and walls. The bed in this hotel was so bad that when I sat down on the edge of it when I first came in, the thin mattress flipped straight up and caused me to crash into the wall, breaking my glasses and spraining my arm. Sleeping in it gave me a vicious back ache. There was limited storage space, the television got one channel, there were few electricl plugs, no refrigerator, no wireless. The landline internet barely worked and the phone plug was so far from the electrical plugs you could not use both at once. Shower was OK. Would rank as one of the worst three I ever stayed in worldwide if not number 1. It took talking to four people before we could cancel our reservation for more than one night. We were so glad to get out of this hotel that we skipped the free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good 'BUDGET' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob-Chris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in the 30's and has SMALL rooms (we expected this). The room we stayed in was on the 9th. floor. The loo and shower were fine but SMALL. Air-con unit worked just about. The elevators are old but work well. Check-in was quick and staff OK. No fridge but ice machine in hallway. Buffet breakfast (included) was OK, if you want better nip across the street to the 24 hour IHOP. Ralph's round the corner and Subway (sandwich place) nextdoor. Very convenient for public transport. Metro a block away. For cheap LAX transfer take the 'Flyaway' bus to Union station and then 2 stops on the Metro or there is a city bus stop right outside the hotel and hourly buses to the LAX central bus station. The trip takes about 1 hour and costs about $4. Convenient for everything Downtown. The tourist information (very helpful) is a block away on Figeuroa. If you just want somewhere to sleep and shower on the cheap as an LA base then this is good. We paid about £48 and were happy for this price. The area is safe, a few beggars, but they're everywhere anyway! If you want SPACE and luxury then go elsewhere - and pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: OtakuGamerGt
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about some reviews i read before my travel. First let me say i went to L.A. for a little vacations and E4All videogame's convention. So i was looking for a place to stay and where i'd be able to move easily all around downtown L.A. and some other near places. If you are looking for an economic place with a great location, this is the right place. It's just a block away from 7th Street Metro Station, where you can take the Metro Red Line to Hollywood, Universal City, Civic Center and many other places. My only complaints about Ritz Milner LA are, the breakfast, which is not bad but could be better and the keycards... OMG it's annoying when your key card does work perfectly in the morning and a few hours later it does not. Fortunately the only thing for you to do it's make your way back to reception and the person there fix it in a few seconds... The Rooms are small (i was in an economical) but for one person is just fine. There's a TV with a very good selection of channels. I always found something good in TV. There's a Ethernet cable for Internet connectivity and the speed is pretty good. If you get hungry, there's a vending machine in the lobby, where you can get a snack, a coke or bottled water. But if you want a more complete meal, there is a 24 hours IHOP across the street, a Subway and a very good pizza place around the corner. If you need a place to take rest at night and store your stuff, I suggest this place... very good and economic place.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: themelonman
Reviews.Content: Arg! I'm here right now and awake on the internet because I'm too nervous to sleep. So far I've squashed at least 6 very-well-fed little ticks that have been crawling across the sheets - and this was the first thing I saw when I entered the room and sat on the (very old,hard-sprung) bed. Haven't we got things that can fix this in this day and age? This is just wrong :(

Reviews.Title: “We started to think it was haunted”
Reviews.Author: mightyseraz
Reviews.Content: As the 2 out of 5 rating indicates, my stay was okay, but had some problems. The place is definitely old, the plaster on the ceiling of our room had apparently shrunk so much over the years that the crown molding was floating about two inches below it. That's not so severe a sin, of course, but it isn't attractive. The elevator nearest the front door was a bit... um, terrifying. But I imagine it was a temporary problem. It was out of order when we arrived, and shortly after being fixed it seemed to go a little haywire. It would frequently leave you on the wrong floor and one time it actually jerked around, dropping us a few feet. It dropped us three times before letting us out out on the 12th floor (it said it was the 8th, and we'd been trying to go to the 10th floor). We didn't ride it again :) Oddly they didn't put an out-of-order sign back up. There are some other disturbing things about it, related to it's age. The stairwell's railings seem strangely low, providing what seems an inadequate barrier between you and an up-to-12-storey fall through the building's interior. The windows on the higher floors are unbarred and waist level. Overall the place gives you the impression that it would be very easy to commit suicide there, and that it's probably been done more than once. But it's cheap, close to the convention center, and is VERY near a Subway sandwich shop, an IHOP, a Denny's, and a convenience store. I don't mean to insinuate the place is a deathtrap, but I wouldn't recommend it for families with that monkey sort of child that has to climb and play on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviewed”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeSC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not as bad as reviewed. The lobby needs to be redone and the elevators may or may not take you to your floor, but we stayed on the 3rd floor and had a very big room. We had a king size bed, a full bath (with a second vanity area), and a nice sitting area. The room was clean and the linens were very clean. The hotel itself is very convenient to everything downtown Los Angeles. You are about 3-4 blocks from the L.A. Convention Center, Staples Center and Nokia Theatre. We were there for a week and walked to all of our destinations.

Reviews.Title: “I thought I was in a wrong hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArtNYC
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was apprehensive in booking this hotel but since I was only staying one night and the location is convenient to what I had to do, I thought I would grin and bear the "bad" conditions described by past guests. To my surprise, 3rd floor was big, no kidding, with good size bathroom and very clean. The furniture and carpet though did not look brand new was not at all shabby. The elevator worked, the room key worked, so did the hot and cold water and with enough coffee. Breakfast was included but I did not have the chance to take it, so I have no comment on that. The staff was very friendly and I witness some of their interactions with other guests which were personable. It is within walking distance to the Metro and enough options for food nearby. I give it 5 stars base on value for money. Would definitely stay here again when I have to return to attend events at the convention center. I booked this hotel through an event travel planner website.

Reviews.Title: “Find a Holiday Inn Instead”
Reviews.Author: toughbroadfrombklyn
Reviews.Content: A dump! Ugly! The room was so small, you could not open the bathroom door all the way. The varnish was coming off the furniture. The chairs were heavily stained. The forgot to give me my wake up call TWICE! They didn't clean out the coffee maker in my room but that was OK because they didn't leave me any coffee. When I called the desk, the clerk had to search around to see if they had coffee but I'd have to pick it up because no one other than he was at work (this was after 7 A.M.). Had to get dressed to troop down stairs to get the coffee. The clerk suggested I get the coffee from the "continental breakfast" they offer. When I did, the woman working there was yelling at me that I was not allowed to take anything out of the breakfast room. All this and yellow water coming from the sink and bath faucets leads me to advise you to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanlovers10
Reviews.Content: As expected from other reviews, I stayed during a convention due to its location and price, I just needed a place to sleep and shower. Yes, small old rooms, with tiny bathrooms, very similar to many European hotels I've stayed at, and the breakfast area needed updating in a bad way. Also, don't expect you're keycard to work. The keycards didn't work for most rooms, and the hardworking staff was always helpful to open the door for you. However, this did create some security concerns in that they were complacent about simply opening the door for anyone standing next to their door with a plastic card in hand and looking frustrated.... The location was excellent. Realatively safe neighborhood, with good police presence. 10 minute healthy walk to the convension center. A block to Ralph's grocery store for their fine deli loaded with a salad bar and meat carving station for a quick, high quality meal. A pizza place and sub shop was 100 feet around the corner while fine dinning was within a block and a half. Breakfast consisted of cereals, bagels, toast, juices, hardboiled eggs, bananas and pears (just ask for more if they're out), and two nice waffle machines. Window AC/heat units worked well and ran quietly, helping drowned out the occasional door slam or people talking in this solidly built older hotel. Never saw a bug in the place during my stay :) !

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in worse”
Reviews.Author: Xara74
Reviews.Content: I was going to LA for a convention, and wanted to save money on a hotel. The Ritz-Milner was the absolute cheapest place to stay that was within a few blocks of the LACC. You can tell that it's an older hotel that has had some renovations. The bed was a bit firm, but all I was in LA to do was see some sites and go to the convention. The room was very very small, yet very clean. I did get up early enough a few times to get breakfast, and it was good, basically the same thing I eat at home, IHOP is right across the street if you want a real breakfast. The staff was helpful, but I didn't really ask them for anything so I don't have any "rude staff" stories. My biggest complaint was the the key card. My boyfriend and I both had cards, but since he got his card after I checked in (his flight came in later) it deactivated my card, so I had to go downstairs and get it reactivated, then when he came back his card was deactivated.... see the trend. This went on all week. We tried to get them both fixed on a few occasions, to no avail so we just used one card and stuck to each other like glue. Other than that, the hotel was exactly what I expected it to be, a low budget place to store my stuff, take a shower, and sleep for a few hours a night, while running around downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: tomthecat
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the ritz after a long flight from australia. the front of the hotel and the lobby looked good. our room was ok. adequate space and clean enough but a bit worn and tatty. had no view from the window (well just a brick wall) and the room was dark day and night, not a big problem as we were jetlagged anyway. it's downtown location meant we were central for shops etc during the day although , because it's in the business district at night it's a quiet area. there are a lot of tramps/beggars in the area.at night they're lying on the streets around the hotel. you need to travel by bus/metro to santa monica, hollywood, rodeo drive, universal, disney etc. which was'nt a problem for us. the pub within the hotel closed early (ish?) 9pm and the restaurant was never open while we were there. i don't think we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: NicciNicci
Reviews.Content: When I got there, they sent me to a room on the 12th floor. The keys didnt work. So my bf had to go downstairs and they "fixed them". Tried again, and a couple comes out. The room was already given to other people. So down the rickety elevator that sounds like its about to die, and we are sent back to the 7th floor. All clear! the room was small, but we didnt really need a huge room. the tv didn't work, and the pad-lock on the door was broken off. The staff was nice, but didnt know anything that was going on. I could hear people screaming at the other staff members wanting new rooms. It was a block away from the event I was attending, so the location was okay. You have to pay for parking, but thats LA for ya. I'd stay there again, but only if it was close to where I was going, and was still only 70$.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: spwinaz
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Milner is very close to several attractions in the downtown area-Orpheum, Staples Center. The staff was friendly but not overly so. Our room was very tiny- the bed was about two feet from the door and the window seemed to be facing an alley which was slightly noisy but not bad with the window shut. Our keys never worked and had to go back down stairs each time to get a new one. Not a big problem though. Parking was easy and we walked to several restaurants close by. Would stay again if i didnt plan to be in the room very much.

Reviews.Title: “Are we all talking about the same place????”
Reviews.Author: jo_cicco
Reviews.Content: I just can't believe we are all talking about the same hotel. Far from being the horrible place some previous users depicted, I found the Ritz Milner great: the location is just fine (just behind Figueroa St, 2 blocks from the Satple Center, 3 blocks from the convention Center, in the hearth of L.A business district) , the staff allright and eager to help you, and the room we got (obviously recently refurnished) was a pleasant surprise, especially after having read some appaling comments! The complementary breakfast (in-house, not anymore at Denys as some first reviews said) is basic, on a -eat-as-much-as-you-like basis. What else? We got our suite for $130 a night during a peak, big meeting period at the C.C. , whereas all aother hotels within a walking distance from the show were at, at the very least, $200. The only downside is that they charge you $2.00/person at the front desk to book a Super Shuttle pick up (that means $8 if you were a family of 4!), which is really mean to my opinion. Apart from that, I definitely will stay again at the Riz Milner, since it proved to be an excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “You can't complain at this price”
Reviews.Author: JoeyLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a long way from being a luxurious hotel but for the price you really can’t complain. The staff are friendly, the beds comfortable and it’s well situated in the heart of Downtown LA. The décor might be more to you grandma’s taste, the breakfast basic and, like previous reviews state, the plasterwork bumpy but does this matter when you’re simply looking for a cheap, comfortable place to stay? My tip is cheat - stay at the Milner then live it large a few blocks down the street at the Standard Hotel’s posh rooftop bar. You’ll have more cash then to splash on the $12 gin and tonics.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLynnS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was one of the hotels associated with a conference I attended. I don't mind old places and don't need alot of room but this place really is a dump.The hallways floors are uneven, the bathroom tiles discolored, and the furniture is very cheap. The elevator down button didn't work on my floor (not just that it didn't light up, but it didn't call the elevator). The daytime front desk woman was sullen and indifferent. Not recommended for single women or the weak of heart. I couldn't use the phone for an 800 number without calling the front desk and having her "turn the line on", which she did with reluctance. There is a Holiday Inn very near; surely that would be a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “run,run like hell!”
Reviews.Author: lizardCanada
Reviews.Content: We Checked in,went to our rooms and checked out, The picture's on the web site are really deceiving,plaster missing on the walls,giant stains on the carpet.Spend the extra $ and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickencurry007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value in a prime location. Anywhere in LA where you can get around for cheap, do it. This hotel is a ten minute walk from the Pico stop on the LA Metro (get off the Metro and turn left. With the Staples Center on your left, continue walking up the street and the hotel is on the left). The staff were really friendly which was great because of some of the reviews I read. They let us check in at 9:30AM, too!! We had a nice room with a Queen size bed. The staff let us keep our lugagge behind the counter when we checked out all day so we could sight-see, too. The free Denny's breakfast is a nice touch, too. I would stay here again any day.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Kapulanikai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in downtown LA close to (8blks) to the Symphony Hall and 6 blks to the sports complex. While the room is tiny it's clean and quiet and hey at the price they're charging cheap Canadians can't complain. Americans do so the reviews will blather on about rude staff, no concegiere to hold their hand etc. Go for it and stay here and enjoy breakfast across the street at Denny's. Let a smile be your umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Great little deal”
Reviews.Author: seadog59
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on other websites ie expedia and so on. But after staying at the hotel it was a pleasant surprise! Very clean and centrally located right downtown and a great price $70!! The room was a bit small but very clean, cable tv, radio and even a coffee maker. I would recommend this hotel to any budget traveler or someone whom just wants to save a few dollars. Everything was close to the hotel including the metro system 2 blocks

Reviews.Title: “Why so negative, the Ritz is fine”
Reviews.Author: lews22
Reviews.Content: I had booked for 4 nights at the beginning of June 2006 before reading the reviews on this website, so I was quite nervous about my stay, as some of the reviews are quite negative. But after 4 days with no problems I am left wondering if those begative people stayed somewhere else. For a budget (not boutique) hotel, this is very good value. The room was cleaned every day, and everything worked. Fresh towels every day, lots of hot water, a clean bathroom. Away from the street, my room was very quiet at night. The staff weren't gushy, but they weren't ever rude, as some reviewers suggest. And when I left a robe in my room, it was held at reception for me to pick up 6 weeks later. Some people complain about the location, and the unsavoury characters on the street. Well, the location, right in downtown LA, next door to the Sheraton, is just fine. Some street people hang out outside the fast food places on the corner of Flower and 8th Street, and sometimes they are loud, but they're harmless enough. There's a parking garage next door ($7 a day) if you have a car. Really, a great place to stay if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Run !!! Run !!! Run away from this hotel. ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL !!!!! BEWARE I WARNED YOU SERIOUSLY. The staff here is extremely extremely rude. Make no mistake. The hotel doesnt have parking space. It costs at a minimum of $10 per one entry into a commercial parking lot right next to the hotel. The worst part is that the parking is not per a day or anything. You need to pay every time you enter the parking lot. YES you read it right. EVERY TIME. Also the rooms are dingy small is a small world to describe the space. I requested two people if they can switch me to a bigger better room and told them that I dont mind paying more. Guess what! the rude staff ( not just one odd man out ) doesnt do it. I interacted with a woman and two men. All three of them were out right rude and behave as if they are the watch guards at a concentration camp and the guests are a burden on them. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - one member of staff extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Ritz Milner for a week during E3. The hotel itself was fine. The room was very small and the shower room (no bath) was really tiny but we didn't spend much time there, just slept there. There was no clear indication of how we should access the internet. There was an ethernet cable in our room but there was a note saying that it needed a credit card (although we had read on Expedia that there was free wireless). On the reception desk it said that there was a charge of $9.95 a day for the net, however we plugged the cable in and it connected without a signup screen or asking for our credit card details. We haven't been charged yet (but who knows, that was the least of our worries). It is in a great location, for downtown LA with bus stops outside and Metro station just up the road. The main problem we had with this hotel was one member of staff. He unfortunately checked us in and out. Although he didn't actually do either of them. When we arrived he barely uttered a word to us and those that he did were rude. We had just travelled for nearly 20 hours and this was the last thing that we wanted. He gave us the key, but it had turned out 2 days later that they thought that we were a no show as he hadn't added us to the computer system. Most days that we were there the key card didn't work and they had to reset it. On the Thursday (we were leaving on the Saturday) we went to get our breakfast voucher and the guy (different guy) on reception said that we had been checked out and luckily there was another person on the desk who got our paperwork out. The one good thing about this hotel was that breakfast was included in the IHOP opposite and it was a big breakfast, 2 eggs, 2 rashers of bacon, or 2 sausages, one massive hash brown and 2 pancakes. Drinks aren't included. The staff at the Ihop were nicer than the hotel staff! The first night we were there I woke up to someone else going into the room opposite where someone else was obviously staying in. It seems that the same rude guy had given someone else the key for an occupied room. I probably would stay there again as the hotel itself was clean, but we slept with the lock on, and I would again.

Reviews.Title: “Run away fast!”
Reviews.Author: Macananina
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Milner in LA was sold to us as part of a package deal which included the flights, and never having been to LA before, we thought we had gotten a great deal for a good price...What a SHOCKER! This hotel (if it can be called that) is covered in dust, worn carpets, chipped toilets, dated bathrooms and claustrophobic rooms! I had stayed in budget hotels a few years ago, as a student, but this was just too bad to be beleived! The area it's located in is not safe at night, and if you think you can get any kind of refreshment, think again! There are no mini bars in the rooms and the hotel itself doesn't have a restaurant or room service! Needless to say, we left ten minutes after arriving and were lucky enough to find a different hotel for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is just horrible! Even after its renovation the rooms are poorly appointed and overpriced for the value received. The front desk staff leaves a lot to be desired. Surly, rude and often not willing to respond to the simplest of request.Try connecting to a room after 6pm. The phone just rings forever and no one ever answers. Just not worth the money. For a couple dollars more stay elsewhere and save the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Recent upgrade???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Ritz Milner Hotel sometime in April. I visited the site starLAhotels. We were searching for a hotel or motel with a moderate price and came in to contacat with Ritz Milner. The picture shown on the site was good enough, and was newly renovated. I went ahead booked a room for three nights but when we checked in the hotel, the outside was ridiculous. There were scuffles all over the place, the entrance was nowehere to be found, there were tour busses which is hindering the entrance. We did know where the entrance was, until we had to asked a bystander and showed us. Upon checked in we proceeded to our room which was on thre 12 floor. Beforehand, I asked the guest services if they have anyroom available on the lower floor and he replied no! So we have not choice but to proceed. When we entered the room, I was surprised. The room stinks, the carpet's dirty; stained all over the carpet, electrical cords were not properly placed which is a safety hazard! I thought, since it was stated newly renovated, I would assume that the hotel rooms are clean, not dirty. It was a very unpleasant utmosphere. The picture was too good to be looked at on the site, but in physical condition was not. I would never, ever stay in that hotel ever. We had to check out the next morning, very early so as not to spoil th rest of our weekend stay. We were supposed to stay there for three nights but ended up only one night. And to date, (which is almost one month) have not received any credit to my account for the one night they owed me. Although I made the reservations via one of the travel agent; she did all what she can with the hotel, but Ritz Milner is not as cooperative. I work in a hotel and have over 35 years experience yet the problem lies with Ritz where they needed my confirmation number which they should have a record of. This is the reason of the delay, but I don't buy that, there are other means of tracing the confirmation besides asking. WOULDN'T ANYONE AGREE??

Reviews.Title: “speechless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap hotel for one person (mois) Summer 2004 this hotel well catered for student budgets, I usually like big chain hotels but this was a trip I was making for personal reasons. I agree the website has NO information on it, I had no idea if I had breakfast or if I was in a trwin/double/queen room, I relied on my agent for that. The pictures made it look great. On arriving I got a real downtown apartment block feel, the liftshafts were old and dingy and I held my breath ascending in case it would stop. I must have been making faces when I went in as I was shocked. The hallways are nice ENOUGH but my room was shocking (I just reminded myself of the price) Carpet was dirty, TV was on an old stand whick looked like it would fall off, lack of storage, drawer unit was stained (cheap pine) the bed had a broken spring to there was a big dip in the mattress. my warderobe was a door into a little musty room with no lighting so I dont know if I left anything behind and 2 auld wire hangers. The batrooom had an old curtain, loose floor tiles and a smell emitting from the drains, bad toileteries trown there and stained towels I was lucky to get a bathtowel and had to make do with handtowels after a shower. There was no minibar as stated, no hairdryer as stated and no iron. Airconditioners were loud and werent really effective for hot august weather. Coffee maker had dirty glass and a foam cup. Now on to breakfast, I was told I had breakfast and was given a card at reception each morning and proceeded to the diner dirty, run down I was scared to eat there dust was an inch thick in the walls and grease lined everything, I was served breakfast by a dirty homeless person one morning and that took the cake!!!! I think he got an hour work to get breakfast each morning. I began to feel I was staying at a fleabag hotel. Then I was told next morning that I wasnt entitled to breakfast anymore because my tour group stopped that deal (I wasnt with a tour grooup, I booked privately) But It was a blessing after previous experiences. I wanted to change rooms but was told it was booked out. Walls paper thin. I dont think I will ever stay there again. Looking across the road at the beautiful Hyatt regency hotel I stayed at the previous year was sickening.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ritz Milner was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in! They don't seem to understand the word customer service. The pictures are deceiving on their website. Notice that they don't have a picture of the rooms. If you have asthma or any allergies, do not stay at this hotel. The air is stale and dusty. I woke up every morning with a tight throat. The loud air conditioning didn't help me get good sleep either. They say that each room comes with iron and ironing board. That's a lie! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. If you don't mind loud air conditioning, stale air, and smell,you can risk it. I'm sticking to major chain hotels from now on! There's a reaon why it's so cheap at Ritz Milner in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located downtown very close to the financial district is at a walking distance from the convention center and one block from the metro. It is a budget hotel with no frills, but clean and confortable. A full breakfast with eggs, bacon, meat and potatoes is complimentary. We enjoyed our staying here, and strongly suggested if you want to visit Los Angeles. it is not far from Cliffton's Cafeteria 648 Broadway street, a pain relief for Italian stomachs. and you can eat in an enchanted forest!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Ritz Milner Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 813 South Flower Street, Los Angeles, CA 90017
